title: Rainham murder: Man arrested in high street for 'killing' woman in her 50s
text:

A man has been arrested on suspicion of murder after a woman in her 50s was found dead in Rainham, Kent.

Police officers and the South East Coast Ambulance discovered the woman's body after being called to a property in the Miers Court Road area of Rainham at 8.32pm.

A man in his 20s was arrested on suspicion of murder shortly afterwards on Rainham High Street.

The man and the deceased were known to each other, Kent Police said in a statement.

The man remains in custody and an investigation by the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate has been launched.

Police said officers were still at the scene in the early hours of Friday.

The woman's death comes just over a week after suspected murder victim Piotr Lacheta's body was found in Dover, Kent.

Rough sleeper Mr Lacheta, from Poland, suffered blunt force trauma to his head, neck and face, according to Kent Online.

Claire Lunn, 47 and Justin Burnett, 37, have been charged with murder.

Tributes have been paid to Mr Lacheta, with friends saying he 'always helped others despite not having much himself', Kent Live reports.

Pal Marcin Pawlak added: "His mother would love to bring her son's body home to Poland. Lay him down next to his father in a family grave.

"Unfortunately, she is not able to cover the cost herself. Although she is a very strong woman, in a last few days she suffered a lot.

"She never thought that she would have to say goodbye to her own child."

A fundraising page has been set up to get Mr Lacheta's body back to Poland.
